instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHRG_BGATE: What is CHRG_BGATE? This is a typo of CHGR_BGATE When you see CHRG_BGATE, assume they meant to type CHGR_BGATE.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message:
Hi, I nearly "fixed" a 820 3115b, It passed all ASD tests, EFI...hardware tests...with no errors, but I can see that when I plug an original apple charger, sometimes charge, sometimes not, even the light shows green but after a few seconds the led turns off, but in OS it says that is charging but it is not really.
What could it be?smc?

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message: If the green light turns off it is a one wire issue. Check magsafe board and also check sense resistor circuits around the 6259.

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message: So is the the 1 wire issue damage/fault to the connector or is it wear and tear on contacts causing lack of electrical contact?

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message: Ok, I started checking continuity with some caps around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and resistors, the macbook pro wasn't connected to the charger, I tested the continuity only half second in <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> did a short and fried!! I had to replaced it and now it recognize when I plug the charger but it says that the battery is not charging :( I don't know what I did wrong

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message:
Measure resistance between pins 17/18, then measure resistance between pins 27/28. The resistance between the pins should be NO GREATER than the resistance of all the resistors in the circuit, so for example <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>, and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>. If the resistance is greater than the total resistance of the current sensing resistors, then either a trace is blown, a via bad, or a resistor bad.

This may help put it into perspective as well.

[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vgeVpYWkwBM[/url]

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message: BTW, a fucked up <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> can short the current sensing section to ground and kill the sense resistors.

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message:
Thanks for the hints :)
Ok I have measure them and pins in <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> 17-18 are: 141,1 Ohms pin 27-28 are: 0,20 Ohms, then <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> 0,001Ohms <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> 139,6 Ohms (probably fucked up <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> 0 Ohms
R 7020 0 Ohms <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> 10 Ohms <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> 10Ohms I´ve been measuring others around the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area and they look good as the schematics says.
So I think I have to change the resistor <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>, or do you think could be a blown trace?

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message: with a 60W charger this voltage is ok, measure in diode mode F7040 red probe to ground.............check sense resistors <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and ACIN

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message:
Anything else corroded, like <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL> line to <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> maybe? That line is right next to your destroyed resistor, and I have had it corrode once or twice before. 

I would remeasure pins 27/28 and pins 17/18 on the pins themselves, not on the cap(I know I cheat and measure on the cap sometimes as well but it's cheating!), and answer aprendiz' above question. This is becoming one of those things where it must be obvious but we are missing something silly.

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 681"]with a 60W charger this voltage is ok, measure in diode mode F7040 red probe to ground.............check sense resistors <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and ACIN[/QUOTE]

DIODE MODE ALL
Unplugged F7040= 0,447V Plugged= OL :)
Unplugged <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>= 0.609V Plugged= OL
Unplugged <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>= 0.608V Plugged= OL
Unplugged <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 3 <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL>= 0.491V Plugged: 0.127V

threads.message:

I would remeasure pins 27/28 and pins 17/18 on the pins themselves, not on the cap(I know I cheat and measure on the cap sometimes as well but it's cheating!), and answer aprendiz' above question. This is becoming one of those things where it must be obvious but we are missing something silly.[/QUOTE]

Nothing corroded on that area, checked <SIGNAL>CHRG_BGATE</SIGNAL> and is fine continuity in <SIGNAL>CHAR_BGATE</SIGNAL> to <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> ok.
Probably is a silly thing like you said, I think is the <SIGNAL>CHRG_ACIN</SIGNAL> the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but Im newbie and I don't know, just starting to understand things now, this is addictive :)

EDIT: 
Sorry I forgot to remeasure pins here we go:

REMEASURED PINS  27/28= 20,2 Ohms
REMEASURED PINS  17/18= 2,9 Ohms

threads.title: Charging problems
threads.message:
Fuck!, this motherboard is driving me crazy, but Im learning a lot.

Ok now I plug the charger I got sometimes green light, sometimes not, when I have green light I get orange light telling me that is charging.
But...before, trackpad was perfect, keyboard, leds keyboards...image and backlight...Now it is not...

Ok here begins the journey:

First I did a reset of smc: I have image, backlight, everything...trackpad is not working and fan spinning high.
Second I reboot, and I have trackpad (the fan is still spinning high) but when I click on the trackpad is not working!! before it was perfect!!

Third I reboot with D (hardware test) everything is good.
Fourth I reboot again and I have no image, no backlight....

So I guess could be the smc but it is very strange...Could be something with the power lines?

What do you recommend me to start with?

Edit: When I reset the SMC and the PRAM the screen turns on, but the fan is spinning high, I have keyboard and trackpad in Efi test, but when I click the trackpad nothing,  then it switch off, I have no keyboard backlight as well and I had before.
